means: （使）押韵，押…韵( rhyme的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He rhymed out sonnets in her praise.
sentence.Network_cn: 他写成押韵的十四行诗歌颂她.

sentence.Network_en: I will continue to write moral stories rhymed couplets.
sentence.Network_cn: 我仍然要写押韵对句的道德故事.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 1.许渊冲的译本韵律强，押尾韵（rhymed），而且green，white，bright的重复（repetition）具有使画面活灵活现的效果，读这个译本 …
...和叙事诗中。莎士比亚的戏剧和弥尔顿的Paradise Lost 都是用blank verse写成的。押韵的诗叫rhymedverse。无韵诗不同与自由诗。无韵诗虽不押韵，但是有固定节奏，以扬抑格五音步最常见。自由诗节奏不固.
he rhymed out sonnets in her praise ., 他写成押韵的十四行诗歌颂她.

阴韵（Feminine rhyme），我国《诗经》里就有（就是连“虚”字“兮”一起押韵，例如“其实【七兮】”和“迨其【吉兮】”押韵），后来就少 …

首页-宝格先生壁纸店-- 淘宝网 ... 花之影 Flower SHADOW 花之韵 Flowers rhyme 花之语 Flowers Language.

entry.def: If one word rhymes with another or if two words rhyme, they have a very similar sound. Words that rhyme with each other are often used in poems.

example.ex: June always rhymes with moon in old love songs.
example.tran: 在老情歌中June总是和moon成韵。

example.ex: ...the sort of people who give their children names that rhyme: Donnie, Ronnie, Connie.
example.tran: 给孩子取Donnie, Ronnie, Connie之类押韵的名字的父母

entry.def: If a poem or song rhymes, the lines end with words that have very similar sounds.

example.ex: In his efforts to make it rhyme he seems to have chosen the first word that comes into his head.
example.tran: 为了押韵，他似乎选择了脑海里出现的第一个词。

entry.tran: 押韵词;同韵词;押韵的诗行
entry.def: A rhyme is a word which rhymes with another word, or a set of lines which rhyme.

example.ex: The one rhyme for passion is fashion...
The lyrics are banal and the rhymes clumsy.
example.tran: 歌词平淡老套，押韵生硬蹩脚。

entry.def: A rhyme is a short poem which has rhyming words at the ends of its lines.

example.ex: He was teaching Helen a little rhyme.
example.tran: 他当时正教海伦一首押韵小诗。

entry.def: Rhyme is the use of rhyming words as a technique in poetry. If something is written in rhyme, it is written as a poem in which the lines rhyme.

example.ex: Porter stayed within the rules of rhyme...

entry.tran: 莫名其妙;无缘无故;毫无道理
entry.def: If something happens or is done without rhyme or reason, there seems to be no logical reason for it to happen or be done.

example.ex: He picked people on a whim, without rhyme or reason.
example.tran: 他选人时总是随心所欲，毫无根据。

means.word_mean: 1. having corrnesponding sounds especially terminal sounds;

auth_sentence.content: Most of its movement would be lost if those first two lines rhymed neatly.
auth_sentence.res_content: Most of its movement would be lost if those first two lines rhymed neatly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Most of its movement would be lost if those first two lines rhymed neatly.

auth_sentence.content: But I like plums, and would be very disappointed if suddenly all poetry rhymed, as much as I like a good rhyming poem.
auth_sentence.res_content: But I like plums, and would be very disappointed if suddenly all poetry rhymed, as much as I like a good rhyming poem.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But I like plums, and would be very disappointed if suddenly all poetry rhymed, as much as I like a good rhyming poem.

auth_sentence.content: He told me that he wanted the poems in his first book, often rhymed and metered, to be accessible to his family.
auth_sentence.res_content: He told me that he wanted the poems in his first book, often rhymed and metered, to be accessible to his family.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He told me that he wanted the poems in his first book, often rhymed and metered, to be accessible to his family.
